Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL TEST TYPE: This reference table identifies the general type of test used toevaluate the potential of the well. For example, Drill Stem Tests (DST), RepeatFormation Tests (RFT), Initial Potential(IP).
Column Comment.3: RUN NUMBER: A number which uniquely identifies the run or trip into the well for thepurpose of operating a test.
Column Comment.4: TEST_NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identify the individual test occurringwithin a test run or trip.
Column Comment.5: RECORDER IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to each recorder.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: MAXIMUM CAPACITY PRESSURE: Capacity pressure is the maximum pressureable to measure.
Column Comment.10: MAXIMUM CAPACITY PRESSURE OUOM: Capacity pressure original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.11: MAXIMUM CAPACITY TEMPERATURE: Capacity temperature is the maximumtemperature able to measure.
Column Comment.12: CAPACITY TEMPERATURE OUOM: Capacity temperature original unit of measure.
Column Comment.13: PERFORMANCE QUALITY: The quality of performance such as good, fair or poor.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.15: RECORDER DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to where the first recorder(pressure gauge) was positioned during the test.
Column Comment.16: RECORDER DEPTH OUOM: Recorder depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: RECORDER IN OUT CODE: Recorder In/Out indicates if measurement was takeninside or outside the tool.
Column Comment.18: RECORDER MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE LIMIT: maximum temperature measuredby the recorder
Column Comment.19: RECORDER MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE OUOM: Maximum temperature limitoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: RECORDER MINIMUM TEMPERATURE LIMIT: Minimum temperature measured bythe recorder
Column Comment.21: RECORDER MINIMUM TEMPERATURE OUOM: Minimum temperature limit originalunit of measure.
Column Comment.22: RECORDER POSITION: The position of a test recorder or gauge relative to the testtool components. For example below or above straddle.
Column Comment.23: RECORDER RESOLUTION: Value for the recorder resolution (+ve or -ve measuredin psi or kpa).
Column Comment.24: RECORDER RESOLUTION OUOM: Recorder resolution original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: RECORDER TYPE: The type of recorder or pressure gauge. For example bourbontube, quartz gauge or strain gauge.
Column Comment.26: RECORDER USE INDICATOR: Recorder used indicator for analysis purposes.
Column Comment.27: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
